content.question: The Second Derivative Test cannot be used to conclude that <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is the location of a relative minimum or relative maximum for which of the following functions?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the cosine of, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, negative 2 x times the sine of, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, negative 2 times the sine of, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, minus 4 times x squared, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, e raised to the, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, times e raised to the, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, 4 times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, times e raised to the, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, power, plus 2 times e raised to the, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 3, end fraction, plus x squared, minus 3 x, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, x squared, plus 2 x, minus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, 2 x plus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, x to the fourth power, minus 4 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, minus 4 x, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 4 times x cubed, minus 12 times x squared, plus 12 x, minus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, 12 times x squared, minus 24 x, plus 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f of x, equals, x to the fourth power, minus 4 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, minus 4 x, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 4 times x cubed, minus 12 times x squared, plus 12 x, minus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, 12 times x squared, minus 24 x, plus 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.7: Using the Second Derivative Test to Determine Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
